head.supplied: Richmond N.S.W ¶ Decr 22 /82 ¶ My dear Baron, ¶ ¶ Will you kindly inform me whether you know any ¶ Pimelea ¶ with foliage similar to the enclosed fragment? It is represented as a shrub of several f...

div.p: RB MSS M46, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

MS found with specimen of Pimelea penicillaris (MEL 58304). M described the species in B83.10.01 on the basis of 'very fragmentary material, received through the Rev. Dr. Woolls from T. W. Shepherd, Esq.'.The location given in the description is 'on Sandland, in the vicinity of the Gwydir'; Warialda is close to the Gwydir river, between Moree and Glen Innes, NSW. M's label has 'Pimelea penicilaris from Gwydir ded.[given by] Woolls' 1882'; J. H. Willis has inserted 'Dec.' above the date and '(From T. W. Shepard)' above 'ded. Woolls'. MS annotation by M: 'Answ 31/12/82 F.v.M'. Letter not found. Richmond N.S.W

Will you kindly inform me whether you know any
Pimelea
with foliage similar to the enclosed fragment? It is represented as a shrub of several feet with a silvery appearance & growing in sandy soil. The one head of flowers sent to me was of a hemispherical or globular shape with an involucre of eight bracts of a heart-shape. Each floret had a pappus like a composite flower. If you think the plant new, I will write to Shepherd (who I think knows the collector) for further specimens.
Though I am in some affliction just now, I must not forget to wish you the Compts of this joyful Season.

div.p:
Warialda is 380 miles north of Sydney
The bottom of the page, beneath the postscript, has been cut off. The text that follows is on the verso, inverted, beginning in mid-sentence immediately after where the paper has been cut off.

[…] the neighbourhood of both species. I hope Mrs Forde
Helena Forde, née Scott. may make a drawing of it
